body_html:
The CPython you have might be compiled with narrow unicode. Could you check with import sysconfig sysconfig.get_config_var('Py_UNICODE_SIZE')? So far we are only providing package for Python2.7 built with UCS4 (-enable-unicode=ucs4) on Pypi as it is used by most Linux distributions.

Does install from the URL work for your use case?
body_text:
The CPython you have might be compiled with narrow unicode. Could you check with import sysconfig sysconfig.get_config_var('Py_UNICODE_SIZE')? So far we are only providing package for Python2.7 built with UCS4 (-enable-unicode=ucs4) on Pypi as it is used by most Linux distributions.
Does install from the URL work for your use case?
body:
The CPython you have might be compiled with narrow unicode. Could you check with `import sysconfig
sysconfig.get_config_var('Py_UNICODE_SIZE')`? So far we are only providing package for Python2.7 built with UCS4 (`-enable-unicode=ucs4`) on Pypi as it is used by most Linux distributions. 

Does install from the URL work for your use case?
